xxl.core.relational.query.predicates
Class Comparisons

java.lang.Object
  xxl.core.relational.query.predicates.Comparisons

public class Comparisons
extends Object

This class provides static methods for creating ready to use instances of a comparison predicate node in a directed acyclic graph. Beside this methods, it contains constants for identifying local metadata fragments inside a predicate node's global metadata, methods for accessing them and local metadata factories for updating them.

See Also:
Node

Nested Class Summary
static class Comparisons.Type
          An enumeration providing the local metadata fragments used in a comparison's global metadata for identifing the comparison's type.

          This constant can be used to denote that a node represents a comparison predicate in the directed acyclic graph.

          This constant is used to identify a comparison predicate's type inside its global metadata.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

ANCHOR_PLACEMENT_STRATEGY

public static final Function<Node,?> ANCHOR_PLACEMENT_STRATEGY
An anchor placement strategy for comparison predicates. The strategy simply places the specified anchor to the given comparison predicate's argument expressions.

XML_READER

public static final Function<Object,Node> XML_READER
A factory method that can be used to transform the XML representation of a comparison predicate into the node itself.

public static final Function<Object,Node> XML_WRITER
A factory method that can be used to transform a comparison predicate into its XML representation.

TRANSLATION_FUNCTION

public static final Function<Object,MetaDataPredicate<Tuple,CompositeMetaData<Object,Object>>> TRANSLATION_FUNCTION
A factory method that can be used to translate a logical comparison predicate into an appropriate implementation.

newComparison

public static final Node newComparison(Comparisons.Type type,
                                       Node firstArgument,
                                       Node secondArgument)
Creates a new comparison predicate of the specified type that compares the two given expressions.

Parameters:
type - the type of the comparison predicate that should be returned.
firstArgument - the first argument to be compared.
secondArgument - the second argument to be compared.
Returns:
a new comparison predicate of the specified type that compares the two given expressions.
